intro: Cnicus bipinnatus, commonly known as the doubleleaf sow-thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has alternate, pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cnicus bipinnatus is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
